text.div:
BC ClinicalNote Logical Model

An entry concerning a patient where the result is a narrative text. Can be related to a specific Focus, such as a condition; and evidence and interpretation from FindingTopic.

name: ClinicalNoteModel
title: BC ClinicalNote Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC)
description: An entry concerning a patient where the result is a narrative text. Can be related to a specific Focus, such as a condition; and evidence and interpretation from FindingTopic.

element.definition: An entry concerning a patient where the result is a narrative text. Can be related to a specific Focus, such as a condition; and evidence and interpretation from FindingTopic.

element.short: The person this entry belongs to.
element.definition: The person this entry belongs to.

element.short: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.
element.definition: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.

element.short: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.
element.definition: The person or entity that provided the information in the entry, e.g. the subject (patient), medical professional, family member, device or software program, as distinct from who recorded the entry.

element.short: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.
element.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

element.short: Context for recording a finding, used to indicate an evaluation has been made.
element.definition: Context for recording a finding, used to indicate an evaluation has been made.

element.short: Provenance information specific to the signing of the clinical statement.
element.definition: Provenance information specific to the signing of the clinical statement.

element.short: Base class - independent of context - for all kinds of determinations: questions/answers, conditions, observations, allergies, and other findings.
element.definition:
Base class - independent of context - for all kinds of determinations: questions/answers, conditions, observations, allergies, and other findings.
The subject of a finding can be the entire patient, or an entity such as a location body structure, intervention, or condition. Things observed about the subject can include social and behavioral factors, subjective and objective observations, and assessments.

element.short: The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.
element.definition:
The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.

For action topics, the TopicCode represents the action being described. For findings, the TopicCode represents the 'question' or property being investigated. For evaluation result findings, the TopicCode contains a concept for an observable entity, such as systolic blood pressure. For assertion findings, the TopicCode contains a code representing the condition, allergy, or other item being asserted. In all cases, the TopicCode describes the topic independent of the context of the action or the finding.

element.short: The technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle.
element.definition: The technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle.

element.short: A text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization. Details can discuss, support, explain changes to, or dispute information.
element.definition: A text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization. Details can discuss, support, explain changes to, or dispute information.

element.short: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.
element.definition: A file that contains audio, video, image, or similar content.
